document_data.mainbody:
ymbals were a percussion They were also used by rock gnomes and in certain Khazari monasteries.
Cymbals consisted of two round thin plates made of brass, which were slammed together to produce sound. A pair of cymbals typically had a diameter of , weighed  and costed 20 gold pieces. A smaller version called finger cymbals was also used in Zakhara.
